title-group.article-title: Monetary Policy and Pricing of Cash-Flow and Discount-Rate Risk

abstract.p: In this paper I examine the pricing of cash-flow and discount-rate risk in the framework of Campbell and Vuolteenaho (2004), conditional on Federal Reserve monetary policy. I find that monetary policy significantly influences the pricing of cash-flow and discount-rate risk. The model can be used to calibrate the relative importance of cash-flow and discount-rate news in transmitting monetary policy effects on stock returns. The well-documented size and value premiums in stock returns also are affected by monetary policy—these are observed mainly in expansive monetary policy environments. The two-factor model successfully explains size and value anomalies when risk prices are allowed to vary in different monetary environments.
